Title: Usage of Configuration Encryption
Rule Description(From CSA): Use of encrypted sections is problematic in cloud environments. Configurations should be externalized as environment variables instead of encrypting them in configuration file.

Title: Stafeful Application
Rule Description(From CSA): App should be executed as a stateless process. User session information could be store in the database (Ex https://www.c-sharpcorner.com/article/configure-sql-server-session-state-in-asp-net-core/). A better approach is to use a Redis or SQL Server distributed cache, which doesn't require sticky sessions. For more information, see Distributed caching in ASP.NET Core (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/performance/caching/distributed?view=aspnetcore-7.0).

Title: File caching IIS module
Rule Description(From CSA): Caching should be managed externally. Relying on IIS Modules won't work in Linux environment. Alternatives are distributed cache solutions like Redis, SQL Server distributed cache, NCache distributed cache.

Title: Use of Integrated Authentication
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows Integrated Authentication will be problematic in the cloud as containers won't be joining Windows Domains. Use another authentication mechanism more cloud friendly like SSO, LDAP Remote Calls, Local...

Title: Use of Integrated Authentication
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows Integrated Authentication will be problematic in the cloud as containers won't be joining Windows Domains. Use another authentication mechanism more cloud friendly like SSO, LDAP Remote Calls, Local...

Title: Usage of hard coded connection strings
Rule Description(From CSA): Remove connection strings from files, use environment variables (or mount configmap into pod)

Title: Usage of hard coded connection strings in configurations
Rule Description(From CSA): Remove connection strings from files, use environment variables (or mount configmap into pod in a docker like environment)

Title: Local File Configuration
Rule Description(From CSA): Externalize configuration to environment or use ConfigMap as file-mount into a K8S pod

Title: Usage of Local File System
Rule Description(From CSA): Relying on the local filesystem to store state is unreliable in a cloud platform. Containers are ephemerals and data could be lost. Data could be stored in database or the application should leverage File Sharing Systems like NFS Persistent Volume (PV) in Kubernetes environment.

Title: Usage of Local File System Path
Rule Description(From CSA): Relying on the local filesystem to store state is unreliable in a cloud platform. Containers are ephemerals and data could be lost. Data could be stored in database or the application should leverage File Sharing Systems like NFS Persistent Volume (PV) in Kubernetes environment.

Title: Launch Additional Processes
Rule Description(From CSA): Launching additional processes within a container like environment is not recommended. In a targeted docker like environment it is generally recommended that you separate areas of concern by using one service per container.

Title: Usage of EventLog
Rule Description(From CSA): Logging to the Event Log is not recommended for cloud native apps. Write to or manage logfiles. Instead, each running process should write its event stream, unbuffered, to stdout. https://docs.lacunasoftware.com/en-us/articles/amplia/on-premises/windows/enable-stdout-log.html

Title: Usage of EventLog
Rule Description(From CSA): Logging to the Event Log is not recommended for cloud native apps. write to or manage logfiles. Instead, each running process should write its event stream, unbuffered, to stdout. https://docs.lacunasoftware.com/en-us/articles/amplia/on-premises/windows/enable-stdout-log.html

Title: Usage of Windows Certificate Stores
Rule Description(From CSA): Relying on Windows certificate stores is problematic in a cloud environment. Certificate stores could be shared via shared volume mounts. Ideally you should decouple certificates and SSL from your application. SSL could also be handled at the load balancer level.

Title: Logging with Serilog
Rule Description(From CSA): Logging with Serilog. Make sure not to log to file. Remote logging sinks need to be reachable on network. Logging to the Event Log is not recommended for cloud native apps. Write to or manage logfiles. Instead, each running process should write its event stream, unbuffered, to stdout.

Title: Dotnet Application Domain
Rule Description(From CSA): Unsupported, For .NET Core, there is exactly one AppDomain. Isolation and unloading are provided through AssemblyLoadContext. Security boundaries should be provided by process boundaries and appropriate remoting techniques

Title: Dotnet Windows Presentation Foundation
Rule Description(From CSA): Desktop technology only available on Windows platform

Title: Dotnet Windows Form
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows Forms module is not supported in the cloud. Refactor to a web application.

Title: Dotnet Windows Principal
Rule Description(From CSA): Operations requiring a Windows domain are not supported in a container like environment. Features relying on Windows authentication will be problematic if targeting linux environment.

Title: Usage of Windows Registry
Rule Description(From CSA): External configurations should be made available by environment variables or some another external service (Property Management Service).

Title: Usage of Windows Services
Rule Description(From CSA): Traditional Windows services will not run on linux environments. Windows services should be turned into their own deployable console application.

Title: Javascript file caching
Rule Description(From CSA): Using caching in memory will not scale when used in a multi nodes environment. Use distributed caching like redis instead.

Title: Javascript File IO
Rule Description(From CSA): Cloud-native applications should not rely on a local filesystem to store information, configuration or logs. Some alternatives could be cloud storage (buckets), storing data in a shared database or leveraging shared mounted volumes in a kubernetes like environment.

Title: Hard Coded IP Addresses
Rule Description(From CSA): Found hard-coded IPv4s. Make configurable, put into environment variables. Leverage config maps in a kubernetes like environment.

Title: Hard Coded URIs
Rule Description(From CSA): Found hard-coded URIs. Make configurable, put into environment or config map

Title: Plain Text Credentials
Rule Description(From CSA): Found plain text credentials. Never save passwords or login information in files. Make configurable, put into environment variables or config maps in a kubernetes like environment. Credentials could also be set and retrieved from cloud friendly crdential vaults.

Title: Usage of ISAPI Filter IIS Module
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows and IIS server dependency. Not supported in .netCore targeting linux.

Title: ISAPI Filter VBCS IIS Module
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows and IIS server dependency. Not supported in .netCore targeting linux.

Title: Usage of IHttpContextAccessor to get IP Address
Rule Description(From CSA): Not supported in .netCore, Use IHttpContextAccessor instead

Title: Usage of Messaging MSMQ
Rule Description(From CSA): MSMQ is a proprietary Windows server-based messaging solution that is not supported by Linux based containers. Leverage bridging solutions like https://kubemq.io/helping-net-msmq-based-services-to-migrate-to-kubernetes/ on kubernetes

Title: Usage of URI Cache IIS Module
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows and IIS server dependency. Not supported in .netCore targeting linux. Implements a generic cache for URL-specific server state; such as configuration. With this module; the server only reads configuration for the first request for a particular URL. And reuse it on subsequent requests until it changes.

Title: Usage of ASP child action
Rule Description(From CSA): Not supported, replace with a new View Component feature https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/mvc/views/view-components?view=aspnetcore-7.0

Title: Usage of ASP Classic 2.0
Rule Description(From CSA): Not supported by many PAS. ASP .net pages will have to be replaced by ASP .NetCore

Title: Usage of ASP Machine Key
Rule Description(From CSA): Not supported in .NetCore. Will have to be replaced https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/security/data-protection/compatibility/replacing-machinekey?view=aspnetcore-7.0

Title: Usage of ASP Membership
Rule Description(From CSA): Not supported, replaced by ASP.NET Core Identity. Manage users in Database.

Title: Usage of ASP MVC Form Collection
Usage of ASP MVC Model Update
Rule Description(From CSA): Not supported in .NetCore, Replace with TryUpdateModelAsync

Title: Usage of ASP MVC
Rule Description(From CSA): Not supported on .netCore. Migrate to ASP .NetCore and replace with Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc

Title: Usage of ASP Session Context
Rule Description(From CSA): Not supported, Replace with IHttpContextAccessor to manage session data

Title: Usage of ASP Web Form
Rule Description(From CSA): Unsupported-netcore. Not supported by many PAS. ASP .net pages will have to be replaced by ASP .NetCore. See https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/architecture/porting-existing-aspnet-apps/migrate-web-forms

Title: Usage of ASP Classic
Rule Description(From CSA): Unsupported-netcore. Not supported by many PAS. ASP .net pages will have to be replaced by ASP .NetCore. See https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/architecture/porting-existing-aspnet-apps/migrate-web-forms

Title: Usage of Delegate Begin and Invoke
Rule Description(From CSA): BeginInvoke and EndInvoke methods on delegates are supported on .NET Core. See https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/migrating-delegate-begininvoke-calls-for-net-core/

Title: Usage of Identity Foundation
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) won't be ported to .NET Core. See https://aka.ms/unsupported-netfx-api.

Title: Usage of Anonymous Authentication IIS Module
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows and IIS server dependency. Not supported in .netCore targeting linux.

Title: Usage of Authentication IIS Module
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows and IIS server dependency. Not supported in .netCore targeting linux. Use Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.Negotiate instead.

Title: Usage of Authorization IIS Module
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows and IIS server dependency. Not supported in .netCore targeting linux.

Title: Usage of Certificate Mapping Authentication IIS Module
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows and IIS server dependency. Not supported in .netCore targeting linux.

Rule Description(From CSA): Windows and IIS server dependency. Not supported in .netCore targeting linux.

Title: Usage of Http Redirection IIS Module
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows and IIS server dependency. Not supported in .netCore targeting linux.

Title: Usage of Isapi Cgi Restriction IIS Module

Title: Usage of Protocol Support IIS Module
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows and IIS server dependency. Not supported in .netCore targeting linux.

Title: Usage of Server Side Include IIS Module
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows and IIS server dependency. Not supported in .netCore targeting linux.

Title: Usage of Tracing IIS Module
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows and IIS server dependency. Not supported in .netCore targeting linux.

Title: Usage of Validation IIS Module
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows and IIS server dependency. Not supported in .netCore targeting linux.

Title: Usage of Reflection Assembly
Rule Description(From CSA): Use AssemblyLoadContext. Evidence is not supported in .NET Core.

Title: Usage of Script Blocks
Rule Description(From CSA): Script blocks are supported only in .NET Framework. They are not supported on .NET Core or .NET 5 or later.

Title: Usage of System Speech
Rule Description(From CSA): System.Speech won't be ported to .NET Core. See https://aka.ms/unsupported-netfx-api.

Title: Usage of System Web Services
Rule Description(From CSA): Upgrade to CoreWCF https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/upgrading-a-wcf-service-to-dotnet-6/ or more modern rest api

Title: Usage of VB Razor View Engine
Usage of WCF Service Model Config
Usage of WF Activity
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows Workflow Foundation (WF) won't be ported to .NET Core. See https://aka.ms/unsupported-netfx-api.

Title: Usage of WF Integration
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows Workflow Foundation (WF) won't be ported to .NET Core. See https://aka.ms/unsupported-netfx-api.

Title: Usage of WF Presentation
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows Workflow Foundation (WF) won't be ported to .NET Core. See https://aka.ms/unsupported-netfx-api.

Title: Usage of Windows Remoting Code
Rule Description(From CSA): Unsupported, consider inter-process communication (IPC) System.IO.Pipes class or the MemoryMappedFile class.Also StreamJsonRpc or ASP.NET Core (either using gRPC or RESTful Web API services).

Title: Usage of Windows Remoting
Rule Description(From CSA): Unsupported, consider inter-process communication (IPC) System.IO.Pipes class or the MemoryMappedFile class.Also StreamJsonRpc or ASP.NET Core (either using gRPC or RESTful Web API services).

Title: Usage of Windows Workflow Foundation
Rule Description(From CSA): Use alternatives, see CoreWF and CoreWCF, runs on windows only and would need to be ran by a console application

Title: Usage of Windows Workflow Foundation
Rule Description(From CSA): Windows Workflow Foundation (WF) won't be ported to .NET Core. See https://aka.ms/unsupported-netfx-api.
